ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The course topics are very interesting, and I liked the fact that it had more of a practical focus (i.e., reviewing a paper for the midterm, writing a grant proposal)
Strength- very understanding professor, light reading, good introduction and explanations.Weakness- lacks discussion, some information appears outdated or inaccurate.
Comprehensive introductions to environmental hormones. Professor is very responsible and shares all her knowledge with students.
great professor and great material application to real world

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Very good--knowledgeable and presented well-organized lectures.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Very understanding and considerate professor. Clearly works hard to provide a good experience.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Love Yaiwei alot. She was very nice, knowledgeable, and approachable.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  great teacher; great speaker from CDC; very helpful

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Light course load, interesting information, and great professor.
The materials are interesting but very specific.Heavy focus on cancers.
